Pixel-based checking is the *last* thing you want to do.  One of the 
fundamental tasks of a good GUI testing system is to decouple the gui 
test from the actual gui layout.  If I want to make sure that selections 
in my list work properly, I want to say things in my test like "select 
first item in the uppermost list", "select last item in the uppermost 
list", etc, and then check to make sure the accessible GUI properties 
(selectedIndex, selectionColor, etc) are what I expect them to be.

Unfortunately, all Robot alone gives you is "give me a mouse press at 
this coordinate", and "check the color of this coordinate".  To be 
useful in unit of functional tests, you need a better abstraction layer 
above Robot (I've written a few, and it's kind of annoying knowing that 
Sun has already done so... :().

T.
